column4: I installed ubuntu on a second hard drive in my computer, with vista on the other, and now when I boot I get grub error 21. the vista drive is set to boot first because my bios won't let me change the boot order

if the goal is to get back into Vista, booting w/ your Vista CD (IIRC) will allow you to restore the boot sector. As far as the Grub error 21, you may be able to repair that w/ a live Ubuntu CD, perhaps someone can chime on on that.

I want to be able to choose which OS to boot at at startup, even though they're on separate drives. I'll try using the vista disc, but I know nothing about repairing error 21 with the live cd (which I'm on now)
